Description: Rim and body fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery krater; cream slip. On the top of the rim, the remains of a cable band . Outside, sphinx to the left, with upraised right forepaw; in the field, cross-incised rosettes and rosettes with incised centres; the outline, as well as interior details, of the sphinx is incised; added red for polos, wing-bow, and alternate tail feathers of sphinx, alternate petals of rosettes and centres of centre-incised rosettes. The interior glazed black with alternating added white and red bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit terms this a dinos, but it is clearly a krater.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 18, no. 59, pl. 15)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (pl. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.397)
